title: Ryan Giggs criticises Marcos Rojo after Man Utd's draw vs Liverpool
text:
Ryan Giggs says Marcos Rojo was at fault for Liverpool’s goal at Old Trafford (Optus Sport)

Ryan Giggs believes Marcos Rojo was at fault for Liverpool’s late equaliser against Manchester United at Old Trafford.

Marcus Rashford opened the scoring in the first half as he met Daniel James’ cross to fire past Alisson from close range.

Liverpool wanted the goal to be disallowed as they felt Divock Origi had been fouled by Victor Lindelof in the build up, but Rashford’s strike was allowed to stand after a VAR check.

United appeared to be on course for a much-needed victory but Lallana met Andy Robertson’s cross from the left to level the score for Liverpool.

And Giggs believes Rojo, who replaced Axel Tuanzebe in the starting line-up after he suffered a hip injury in the warm-up, should have done better to stop the Liverpool midfielder from scoring.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘[Aaron] Wan-Bissaka has not played a lot of games, maybe if he was a little bit fitter and sharper he would have got out quicker,’ Giggs told Optus Sport.

Adam Lallana scored Liverpool’s equaliser in the 85th minute (AP Photo)

‘But for Rojo to actually go past [Harry] Maguire is strange. If he holds his position maybe he can clear it.

‘Ash [Young] never really gets goal-side.

‘But if you watch Rojo he just anticipates where the ball is going to be instead of staying with his man.

Adam Lallana rescued a point for Liverpool (AP Photo)

‘I think it’s a poor goal to give away.

‘But Liverpool, for that five and ten minutes, were knocking at the door and there you see Robertson crossing the ball a lot further up the pitch.

‘Where for the majority of the game, him and Trent Alexander-Arnold were crossing the ball from 40, 45 yards out.’
